thread.title: The Conference Board Leading Economic Index® (LEI) for the U.K. Increased
thread.title_full: The Conference Board Leading Economic Index® (LEI) for the U.K. Increased - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: The Conference Board Leading Economic Index® (LEI) for the U.K. Increased
text:
The Conference Board
NEW YORK , Oct. 12, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- T he Conference Board Leading Economic Index® (LEI) for the U.K. increased 0.2 percent in August to 112.6 (2010 = 100), following a 0.2 percent decline in July, and a 0.2 percent decline in June.
At the same time, The Conference Board Coincident Economic Index® (CEI) for the U.K., a measure of current economic activity, increased 0.2 percent in August to 106.3 (2010 = 100), following a 0.1 percent increase in July, and a 0.2 percent increase in June.
In August, the LEI for the U.K. increased after three straight monthly declines and its six-month growth rate remains just slightly in positive territory. Meanwhile, the CEI has been on a modest growth trajectory this year with the strengths widespread among its components. Taken together, the current behavior of the composite indexes suggests that the economy is likely to continue to grow into early next year, but the pace is unlikely to pick up.
About The Conference Board Leading Economic Index ® (LEI) for the U.K.
The composite economic indexes are the key elements in an analytic system designed to signal peaks and troughs in the business cycle. The leading and coincident economic indexes are essentially composite averages of several individual leading or coincident indicators. They are constructed to summarize and reveal common turning point patterns in economic data in a clearer and more convincing manner than any individual component – primarily because they smooth out some of the volatility of individual components.
The seven components of The Conference Board Leading Economic Index ® for the U.K. include:
Order Book Volume, CBI Monthly Enquiry
Volume of Expected Output, CBI Monthly Enquiry
Consumer Confidence
Stock Prices, FTSE all share price index
Yield Spread, 10 years minus Bank Rate
Productivity, Whole Economy Index
Total Gross Operating Surplus of Corporations
For more information including full press release and technical notes:
http://www.conference-board.org/data/bcicountry.cfm?cid=2
For more information about The Conference Board global business cycle indicators:
http://www.conference-board.org/data/bci.cfm
About The Conference Board
The Conference Board is an independent business membership and research association working in the public interest. Our mission is unique: To provide the world's leading organizations with the practical knowledge they need to improve their performance and better serve society. The Conference Board is a non-advocacy, not-for-profit entity holding 501 (c) (3) tax-exempt status in the United States. www.conference-board.org .
